data.title: Great Atmosphere. Elvis Decor.
data.text: The atmosphere is great, Elvis and vintage décor ever where. This is a quaint and friendly place. Very attentive. I ordered the beef tacos and truthfully I have had better tacos at other venues. The meat was not flavored at all, it tasted like boiled shredded beef to me. The taco shells and the chips were a bit thicker then I like and hurt my teeth. So maybe it was an off night but I did not enjoy my meal.

data.title: Garlic Tacos!!!!
data.text:
If you love Elvis, garlic, and tacos, this is the place to be.  Floor to ceiling (literally) of Elvis memorabilia, they have the best garlic tacos which you can order with shredded beef or chicken, served in a crispy hard shell, packed with meat of your choice and topped with their famous garlic sauce.

You may order a la carte or combination plate with beans and rice.  The chips are fresh but as someone else indicated, the salsa is surprisingly bland.  Everything else we have ordered are pretty tasty.

Plenty of seating, but a bit too close to each other so it gets pretty loud and noisy when full.

Limited street parking, but there are two large parking lots just across the street.

data.title: Amazing Elvis Collection
data.text:
Stopped in for dinner this evening. 
We were impressed with the friendliness and attentiveness of the staff.

Can't say as much for the food. It was mediocre.

The Elvis collection was outstanding!

We noticed they have karaoke Friday and Saturday nights. We'll be back to check that out.

data.title: Elvis memorabilia
data.text: I've been here 3 times and have been disappointed with the food each time. The chicken in the enchilada is dry. Salsa wasn't very tasty .  The best part is the Elvis memorabilia.

data.title: Fun restaurant!
data.text: I don't venture to Garden Grove much but a friend suggested this restaurant before we were to see a play down the street.  I enjoyed this Elvis-themed Mexican restaurant.  Tons of decorations on the wall and Elvis movies on loop.  The food was pretty good.  I need to try more items before I can say it's authentic but I will definetely come back.  This will be a fun place to take friends. We were there early on a Saturday night but I hear the have karaoke.

data.title: Average food, ok service
data.text: We went there on a Friday evening during Main Street car show...food was good but nothing spectacular. Service was ok even though it wasn't busy when we arrived....manager//owner (?) was hustling seating people/getting chips but other than her it was just ok . Cool Elvis memorabilia....

data.title: Elvis is alive in Garden Grove
data.text: Good food always something to see there. They have Elvis movies playing and memorbilia galore so much fun. Friday night out front on Main st is old car night.

data.title: Delicious & Fun Saturday Night
data.text:
We had been to Azteca before, but never on a Saturday night.  It was surprisingly empty when we first arrived, but began to fill up a bit after about 30 minutes.  Friday & Saturday nights are karaoke night, and it seems to bring people in, but it never really got too crowded, where it was uncomfortable.  It really had a welcoming, friendly atmosphere.  If you've never been, you might be surprised to see all of the Elvis memorabilia displayed all over the restaurant, so if you have a problem with Elvis, that might be an issue, otherwise it's pretty quirky-cool.

I guess they are famous for their garlic tacos, with either chicken or beef, they come in crunchy shells, and the garlic dressing is very garlicky; they are really, really, delicious! My husband had the Mexico City Burrito which comes with your choice of meat, the standard is pork, but you can choose another.  He said it was very good, and it looked delicious. Our daughter had the children's Taquitos (minus the sour cream) which also comes with guacamole.  My daughter loves them, and I have tasted them, and they are quite good; loaded with all white meat shredded chicken.  They are also very large, not the typical skinny taquito.  This time, along with the complimentary chips and salsa, we started with an appetizer of chicken wings.  They were some of the best wings I've had in a restaurant.  The skin was actually crispy, and cooked well done, unlike a lot of places that serve soft chewy skin.  The buffalo sauce is a spicy garlic buffalo sauce which is out of this world yummy, yet not as spicy as I would expect.
After we ate, we stayed to watch some of the patrons and employees sing karaoke.  That was a lot of fun, our daughter even had the courage to go up and give it a try (she's very shy and normally would not do anything like that, but this restaurant was so warm and friendly she felt at home).  Everyone was so nice to her, the staff, and the customers, cheering her on, and fussing over her when she was done singing Taylor Swift's "Shake it Off".  Everyone enjoyed her song choice as much as her singing!
All in all, this was one of the best family nights out..delicious food, wonderful people, and fantastic entertainment.

data.title: Fun Mexican Cantina....Elvis Style
data.text: We accidently discovered Azteca restaurant last Friday evening accident.  We read about a classic car show that occurs on Main Street every Friday from 4-6.  It was fun and there we found this gem of an old fashioned Mexican food all decorated and honoring Elvis Presley.  Some might find it tacky but we thought it was weird and wonderful.  And we had not eaten yet.  This is the first Mexican place in southern ca. outside of Santa Ana that has crispy tacos, not soft, fresh hot sauce, real chile verde and all the stuff a lot of us were raised on in AZ, New Mexico and So. CA.  Loved it, the place was clean as could be, mostly locals eating there and we will be back.  Loved the staff.

data.title: Best Kept Mexican. Restaurant
data.text: Elvis and Mexican food were an unlikely combination but this place was spectacular. Our family visited Azteca and we tried a number of their dishes and liked every single one. We also wound up showing up on the Night that they had an Elvis impersonator and it was more fun than we've had in along time. Friendly owner was very outgoing very accommodating. I would recommend this restaurant to couples families or just for a good time

data.title: Excellent lunch specials
data.text: Very nice staff and a great place for lunch.  The specials are very reasonably priced and affordable.  I enjoyed the Mexico City burrito and the tortilla chips were crisp and fresh.  The decor was whimsical with all of the Elvis memorabilia and movie posters.  The dinner menu looked quite good as well.  I would definitely dine at Azteca again.

data.title: A Nice Place to Have Dinner Before a Show at the Gem or Garden Grove Amphitheater
data.text: The Garlic Steak was very tender and tasty, if a little undercooked.  I ordered medium rare and the inside was almost blue, but still satisfactory to me.  My companion had carnitas which was sliced, instead of chunky, and a little dry.  The guacamole was bland.  They serve their margaritas in 12 oz tumblers.  Can't complain about that!  The decor is filled with Elvis memorabilia which is fun to look at, and the bar was hopping on a Thursday evening at 6:30 PM.  The service was pleasant and attentive.  I'd try it again to sample other items on their menu.

data.title: Decent Service, Decent Salsa and Lots of Elvis Stuff
data.text: I really can't say much more. The food was so bland. It reminded me of eating in a high school cafeteria or a run down cafeteria in a government building. The place is good for Elvis fans or if you need fuel but don't expect taste. My wife had a bowl of Soup she couldn't finish it and I had a simple entrée called Chille Relleno with shredded beef taco that was horrible. I could only eat the taco and nothing more.  This is worse than Tex Mex in the MidWest or El Salvadoran food in DC. I would not repeat and I don't recommend. We did our best to support Main Street but never again. Price was $22.00 for an Entrée and bowl of soup and two waters. Ouch1

data.title: Elvis has not left the building here.
data.text: We have a tradition with long time friends to toast good times and The King at this Elvis Bar.  It is a very cozy place and they have good drinks and appetizers.  It can get lively at times in a good way!

data.title: Great for Take Out
data.text:
Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Garden Grove

We only do their take-out. I can walk to it. Love their Chile Rellenos. Have gotten at least a dozen meals there without a dud. Appetizers could be slightly better. Prices could be slightly lower, like everywhere else.

Steve & Cyndi Viall

data.title: horrible food & service
data.text: very greasy food & awful tasting...my wife could not even eat more than 1 bite...and my daughter ordered a quesadilla which looked like it was dipped in a bowl of grease before serving it...asked for a beer & waiter was MIA...got the beer just before we got the check....NEVER GO THERE!!!

data.title: Kitschy fun
data.text:
I ended up here completely by accident while at a convention in Aneheim. A collegue and I went out looking for someplace to have dinner and found ourselves on Main Street in Garden Grove. We picked a restaurant based on good Yelp reviews, but when we looked at the menu posted outside we decided to look elsewhere. We saw the sign for Azteca and decided we would have Mexican.

We had no idea that this was not a run- of-the-mill Mexican place until we walked in. The place is decorated from top to bottom with Elvis memorabilia. The story of why is printed on the menu.

The food was good (not extraordinary, but very good) and the service was exceptional. 

The is a must see for any Elvis fan or anyone who just enjoys Mexican food and wants a unique experience.

data.title: Great Mexican Resturant
data.text: With the Elvis theme and great drinks. I had an amazing time . The service was good and the food was great.

data.title: Specials Not So Special
data.text:
My sister and I ate at Azteca a few weeks ago.  They had a couple of specials, crab enchilada and crab tostada, so we ordered one of each.  The tostada had something that looked and tasted like cat food, topped with a small amount of lettuce and a few pieces of tomato and nothing else - and it was awful!  My sister could not eat more than a few bites.  I had the enchilada and it was equally bad, as I ate maybe half of it (at least it had sauce on it).  After my sister saw a review on tv by a local station where they raved about the food, this was a major disappointment!  

At least we could look at all the Elvis memorabilia to take our minds off the awful food.  We will never recommend this place to anyone we know.

data.title: A Must for Elvis Fans
data.text: This is a fun place to go dine, especially if you are an Elvis Presley fan. The place is decorated with Elvis memorabilia everywhere you look. As for the food, I like it a lot, the enchiladas are really good, love the sauce. The service was awesome and the staff very friendly. They also have night time entertainment that includes karaoke and Elvis impersonators. Check this place out, you'll have a blast!
